intro: Cyphostemma huillense, commonly known as the Huillense moonvine, is a climbing plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the family Asclepiadaceae and is characterized by its slender, twining stems and distinctive, waxy leaves. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers that are typically yellow or greenish-yellow in color. Its fruit is a follicle that splits open to release small, hard seeds. Cyphostemma huillense is often found in arid or semi-arid environments, adapting to harsh conditions with its succulent-like leaves and deep root system.
